intro: Peristylus pachyneuroides, commonly known as the velvetleaf pachyneuroides, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, broad leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
